thread.title: European Index Futures Signal Stock Rebound After Five-Day Drop
thread.title_full: European Index Futures Signal Stock Rebound After Five-Day Drop - Bloomberg Business

author: Namitha Jagadeesh
title: European Index Futures Signal Stock Rebound After Five-Day Drop
text:
European stock-index futures rose, indicating equities will climb after their worst five-day decline of 2015.
Futures on the Euro Stoxx 50 Index expiring in September added 0.4 percent to 3,532 at 7:07 a.m. in London.
The Stoxx Europe 600 Index extended declines yesterday amid concern over China’s economy, trimming its July advance to 1.2 percent. The benchmark gauge has given up more than half of the rally sparked by Greece’s agreement with its creditors. It’s still heading for the biggest monthly gain since March.
The earnings season is in full swing, with about 170 Stoxx 600 companies reporting through the end of the week. Analysts project profit to grow 6.7 percent this year.
Orange SA may move after reporting second-quarter sales and earnings that beat estimates. Michelin & Cie. may be active after Europe’s biggest tiremaker said first-half operating profit rose, boosted by a weaker euro and higher volume in its home region.
Statoil ASA may move after Norway’s biggest oil and gas producer reported second-quarter profit that exceeded projections. BP Plc may move after reporting earnings that missed analysts’ estimates.
Volkswagen AG may be active. Toyota Motor Corp. made fewer first-half deliveries than its German rival, making Volkswagen the biggest automaker in the period.
Melrose Industries Plc may move after agreeing to sell its Elster business to Honeywell International Inc. for 3.3 billion pounds ($5.1 billion).
